task.title: Washing clothes in stackable laundry machines
task.shortdesc: Instructions for using stackable laundry machines commonly found in shared housing facilities.

prereq.p: People must bring their own laundry detergent, fabric softener, bleach, and any other cleaning agents they would like to use.

step.cmd: Put dirty clothes in the washing machine drum located at the bottom of the stackable unit.

choices.choice: Optional: Separate clothes by color and fabric type to prevent damage or color bleeding.

step.cmd: Add the appropriate amount of detergent to the washing machine.

choices.choice: If using a pod, put it in the washing machine drum before adding clothes.
If using liquid or powdered detergent, put it into the detergent compartment in the pull-out drawer, typically located on the top section of the machine.
Optional: Add bleach and/or fabric softener to their respective compartments in the drawer if needed.

step.cmd: Close the washing machine door securely.
Select the appropriate wash settings on the control panel, usually located above the washing machine door.
step.info: Note: The settings will reset to default after each use, so check the panel before each wash cycle.

step.cmd: Press the start button to begin washing.
Transfer the washed clothes from the washing machine to the dryer drum, located on top of the stackable unit.

choices.choice: Optional: Add dryer sheets or wool dryer balls to reduce static and add softness.

step.cmd: Select the appropriate drying settings on the dryer control panel, usually located above the dryer door.
step.info: Note: Select a lower heat setting for delicate or synthetic fabrics to prevent damage.

step.cmd: Press the start button to begin the drying cycle.

taskbody.postreq: Users can always set a personal timer to keep track of the remaining wash and dry time.
